EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLAN 
Bozzuto's Emergency Response Plan is organized in multiple levels of response, many of which are by trained Bozzuto's employees. The Emergency Response Team is the core of the response plan. This team is trained in the Emergency Response Plan procedures and implementation. The Emergency Response Team meets to review procedures and discuss new and improved methods of response. Among the benefits of having a trained in-house response team are reduced response time and more immediate decision making capabilities; these qualities greatly contribute to minimizing the effects in the event of an actual emergency. The Cheshire Fire Department is an important part of Bozzuto's Emergency Response Plan, and are kept current with Bozzuto's facility information. Bozzuto's continues to revise and improve its Emergency Response Plan. This effort is part of Bozzuto's commitment to the health and safety of its employees and community.

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY 
Bozzuto's is continually looking for new ways of improving the safety level of its employees and community. Bozzuto's continues to work with an experienced hazardous materials spill contractor. The intention of the partnership is to provide Bozzuto's additional specific expertise in the field of hazardous materials release procedures and prevention. Continuing discussions and exercises are planned to ensure an efficient and prompt response time. Bozzuto's plans to continue its efforts and commitment to health and safety

ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM 
Bozzuto's views the risk of accidental release very seriously. 
Accidental release prevention programs include: 
- Process Safety Management / Risk Management, 
- Hazard Communication, 
- Lockout / Tagout, and - Risk Management. 

Through a Process Hazard Analysis Study, Bozzuto's uses a hazard and operability study to identify potential accidental release conditions. Solutions are then developed to prevent or limit these conditions from happening. If an incident were to happen, an investigation would take place, and new procedures would be implemented so a similar occurrence could be prevented. All Bozzuto's prevention programs are audited at regular intervals to validate their effectiveness; the objective is to be proactive in preventing accidental releases, not reactive.

INTRODUCTION 
Bozzuto's Inc is a wholesale food distributor based in central Connecticut for over fifty years.  In August of 1995, Bozzuto's completed construction of a state of the art warehouse distribution center. Among its advantages, this distribution center utilizes the benefits of ammonia as a refrigerant. Bozzuto's does recognize ammonia as a hazardous chemical, and this was a consideration when selecting the refrigerant for the facility. In consideration of the risks associated with the use of ammonia, Bozzuto's commits its efforts to ensuring the employees and surrounding community continue to enjoy a healthy and safe environment.
Part of this commitment includes: 
- Employing only skilled refrigeration technicians; 
- Contracting with only experienced ammonia refrigeration contractors; 
- Organizing an in-house Emergency Response Team; 
- Coordination with the Cheshire Fire Department; 
- Partnering with a hazardous materials release contractor; and 
- Maintaining communication with the designated Local Emergency Planning Commission. 

Bozzuto’s senior management assumes an active role in overseeing the overall ammonia safety programs, demonstrated by active participation in program audits, observing and critiquing ammonia release drills and serving as the liaison in building relationships and establishing open communication with local LEPCs and emergency responders.
